Indications: Short-term therapy of moderate or severe anxiety & anxiety associated with depression.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity to benzodiazepines. Acute narrow-angle glaucoma. Myasthenia gravis, acute pulmonary insufficiency, phobia, chronic psychotic obsession.
Adverse_Reactions: Drowsiness, ataxia/muscle weakness, amnesia, depression, light-headedness, confusion, hallucinations, blurred vision.
Diseases: Anxiety; Insomnia; Premenstrual Dysphoric Disorder.

Indications: Short-term treatment of anxiety or anxiety-related depression.
Contraindications: Narrow-angle glaucoma; severe resp insufficiency; myasthenia gravis; sleep apnoea syndrome.
Adverse_Reactions: Sedation followed by dizziness, weakness & unsteadiness; disorientation; depression; nausea; headache; sleep disturbance; agitation; dermatology symptoms; blurred vision; reduction of blood tension; amnesia; temporary memory disorder.
Diseases: Anxiety; Insomnia; Epilepsy; Epilepsy (Pediatric); Nausea & Vomiting.

Indications: Conditions associated with anxiety, tension, sleep disorders caused by mental & emotional disorders.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity. Myasthenia gravis. History of drug or alcohol dependence. Sleep apnoea syndrome. Severe resp failure or chronic obstructive airways disease accompanied by a threat of resp arrest. Pregnancy & lactation.
Adverse_Reactions: Fatigue, dry mouth, constipation, loss of appetite, nausea, dizziness, finger tremors, restlessness, irritability, muscle weakness, difficulty in sleeping, symptoms of irritability.
Diseases: Anxiety; Insomnia; Epilepsy; Epilepsy (Pediatric).

Indications: Anxiety-related disorders, emotionally-induced autonomic symptoms & psychoneurotic disorders. Pre-surgical medication, the night before surgery.
Contraindications: Primary depressive disorders; primary treatment of psychosis. Pregnancy. Childn <12 year.
Adverse_Reactions: Drowsiness, dizziness, clumsiness, sedation, tiredness or weakness, sleep disturbances; change in appetite; visual disturbance; GI effects.
Diseases: Anxiety; Insomnia; Epilepsy; Epilepsy (Pediatric); Nausea & Vomiting.

Indications: Short-term management of anxiety. Adjunct in the relief of muscle spasm & muscle hypertonicity. Alcohol withdrawal symptoms, pre- & post-op conditions.
Contraindications: Resp depression; acute pulmonary insufficiency; sleep apnoea syndrome; not for chronic psychosis. Severe hepatic impairment. Injection: Neonates.
Adverse_Reactions: Drowsiness, lightheadedness, ataxia, amnesia, dependence, paradoxical increase in aggression, muscle weakness, libido changes.
Diseases: Anxiety; Insomnia; Epilepsy; Epilepsy (Pediatric); Low Back Pain.

Indications: Neurotic states, psychosomatic states, rheumatic & traumatic muscular disorders. Alcohol withdrawal symptoms, status epilepticus, pre-op & post-op conditions.
Contraindications: Severe psychoses; acute narrow-angle glaucoma; acute asthma attacks; myasthenia gravis. First trimester of pregnancy. Premature infants or neonates.
Adverse_Reactions: Mental disturbance, drowsiness, amnesia, dependence; blurred vision; urinary retention; resp depression, hypotension.
Diseases: Anxiety; Insomnia; Epilepsy; Epilepsy (Pediatric); Low Back Pain.

Indications: Neurotic states, psychosomatic states, rheumatic & traumatic muscular disorders. Alcohol withdrawal symptoms, status epilepticus, pre-op & post-op conditions.
Contraindications: Severe psychoses; acute narrow-angle glaucoma; acute asthma attacks; myasthenia gravis. First trimester of pregnancy. Premature infants or neonates.
Adverse_Reactions: Mental disturbance, drowsiness, amnesia, dependence; blurred vision; urinary retention; resp depression, hypotension. Ataxia, pulmonary depression, tremor, vertigo, constipation, slurred speech.
Diseases: Anxiety; Insomnia; Epilepsy; Epilepsy (Pediatric).

Indications: Anxiety including anxiety neurosis, disorders & symptoms. Combination of anxiety & depression including anxiety associated with depression. Panic disorders with or without agoraphobia.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity to benzodiazepines & alprazolam. Acute narrow-angle glaucoma.
Adverse_Reactions: Depression; sedation, somnolence, ataxia, memory impairment, dysarthria, headache, dizziness; dry mouth, constipation; fatigue, irritability. Decreased appetite; confusional state, disorientation, decreased/increased libido, anxiety, insomnia, nervousness; balance disorder/impairment, coordination abnormal, disturbance in attention, hypersomnia, lethargy, tremor; blurred vision; nausea; sexual dysfunction; decreased/increased weight. Dermatitis.
Diseases: Anxiety; Insomnia; Premenstrual Dysphoric Disorder.

Indications: General anxiety disorder & symptoms of nonspecific anxiety with or without depression.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity.
Adverse_Reactions: Sedation, gastric discomfort, sleep difficulties, dizziness, restlessness, lightheadedness, nervousness.
Diseases: Anxiety; Premenstrual Dysphoric Disorder.

Indications: Anxiety including anxiety neurosis, disorders, symptoms of anxiety; mixed anxiety (depression, including anxiety associated with depression); panic disorders including panic disorder with or without agoraphobia.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity to benzodiazepines, alprazolam. Acute narrow angle glaucoma.
Adverse_Reactions: Depression, sedation, somnolence, ataxia, memory impairment, dysarthria, dizziness, headache, constipation, dry mouth, fatigue, irritability. Drowsiness & slurred speech in patients with panic-related disorders. Decreased appetite, confusional state, disorientation, decreased or increased libido, anxiety, insomnia, nervousness, balance disorder, abnormal coordination, attention disturbance, hypersomnia, lethargy, tremor, blurred vision, nausea, dermatitis, sexual dysfunction, decreased & increased weight.
Diseases: Anxiety; Premenstrual Dysphoric Disorder; Insomnia.

Indications: Premed before induction of anesth. Basal sedation before diagnostic or surgical interventions. Induction & conscious sedation.
Contraindications: Hypersentivity to benzodiazepines. History of acute narrow-angle glaucoma. Intrathecal or epidural administration. Premature infant.
Adverse_Reactions: Arterial BP, pulse rate & breathing changes; nausea, vomiting, headache, hiccups, laryngospasm, dyspnea, hallucination, ataxia, skin rash, paradoxical reactions, amnesic episodes, resp depression, apnea.
Diseases: Insomnia; Epilepsy; Epilepsy (Pediatric).

Indications: Anesth used in premed induction & maintenance of general anesth. Basal sedation in diagnostic procedure & local anesth.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity to benzodiazepine. Resp insufficiency, acute narrow-angle glaucoma.
Adverse_Reactions: Agitation, involuntary movement, slurred speech, lethargy, dizziness, thrombophlebitis, thrombosis.
Diseases: Insomnia; Epilepsy; Epilepsy (Pediatric).

Indications: Anaesth used in premed, induction & maintenance of general anaesth, basal sedation in diagnostic procedure & local anaesth.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity to benzodiazepine. Resp insufficiency, acute narrow-angle glaucoma.
Adverse_Reactions: Agitation, involuntary movement, slurred speech, lethargy, dizziness, thrombophlebitis, thrombosis.
Diseases: Insomnia; Epilepsy; Epilepsy (Pediatric).

Indications: Major depressive disorder in adults.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity. Concomitant use with non-selective MAOIs or selective MAO-A inhibitors.
Adverse_Reactions: Nausea. Abnormal dreams; dizziness; diarrhoea, constipation, vomiting; pruritus, including generalised pruritus.
Diseases: Depression.

Indications: Major depressive episodes, panic disorder with or without agoraphobia, social anxiety disorder (social phobia), generalized anxiety disorder, obsessive-compulsive disorder.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity. Concomitant use with non-selective, irreversible MAOIs; pimozide.
Adverse_Reactions: Nausea. Decreased/increased appetite, increased weight; anxiety, restlessness, abnormal dreams, decreased libido, anorgasmia in females; insomnia, somnolence, dizziness, paraesthesia, tremor; sinusitis, yawning; diarrhoea, constipation, vomiting, dry mouth; increased sweating; arthralgia, myalgia.
Diseases: Anxiety; Premenstrual Dysphoric Disorder; Depression; Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder.

Indications: Depression symptoms with or without history of mania.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity.
Adverse_Reactions: Nausea, diarrhea, dyspepsia, tremor, dizziness, insomnia, dry mouth, decreased appetite.
Diseases: Anxiety; Premenstrual Dysphoric Disorder; Depression; Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder; Postpartum Depression.

Indications: Depression.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity. Kidney failure (GFR <10 mL/min).
Adverse_Reactions: Fatigue, fever, nausea, dry mouth, anorexia, dyspepsia, vomiting, headache, nervousness, insomnia, drowsiness, anxious, tremor, dizziness, pharyngitis, dyspnea, rash.
Diseases: Anxiety; Premenstrual Dysphoric Disorder; Depression; Fibromyalgia; Headache; Migraine Headache; Narcolepsy; Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder; Postpartum Depression.

Indications: Depression. Diabetic peripheral neuropathic pain (DPNP). Treatment of generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) & prevention of recurrence for 6 month.
Contraindications: Concomitant use with non-selective irreversible MAOIs & potent CYP1A2 inhibitors eg, fluvoxamine, ciprofloxacin, enoxacin. Hepatic & severe renal (CrCl <30 mL/min) impairment.
Adverse_Reactions: Nausea, headache, dry mouth, fatigue, somnolence, insomnia, dizziness, constipation, diarrhea, decreased appetite, hyperhydrosis.
Diseases: Anxiety; Cancer Pain; Depression; Fibromyalgia; Neuropathic Pain; Low Back Pain; Osteoarthritis; Diabetes Mellitus.

Indications: Depression including depression with associated anxiety. Anxiety or generalized anxiety (including long-term treatment), social anxiety & panic disorders. Prevention of relapse & recurrence of depression.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity. Concomitant use with MAOIs.
Adverse_Reactions: Insomnia; headache, dizziness, sedation; nausea, dry mouth, constipation; hyperhidrosis. Decreased appetite; abnormal dreams, nervousness, decreased libido, agitation, anorgasmia; akathisia, tremor, paraesthesia, dysguesia; visual impairment, accommodation disorder, mydriasis; tinnitus; tachycardia, palpitations; HTN, hot flush; dyspnoea, yawning; diarrhoea, vomiting; rash, pruritus, night sweats; hypertonia; urinary hesitation & retention, pollakiuria; erectile dysfunction ejaculation disorder; fatigue, asthenia, chills; decreased/increased weight.
Diseases: Anxiety; Premenstrual Dysphoric Disorder; Cancer Pain; Depression; Headache; Migraine Headache; Narcolepsy; Postpartum Depression; Chronic Pelvic Pain; Chronic Pelvic Pain in Women; Neuropathic Pain.

Indications: Major depressive episodes.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity. Concomitant treatment with nonselective irreversible MAOI, pimozide.
Adverse_Reactions: Increased/decreased appetite; anxiety, restlessness, abnormal dreams, decreased libido, anorgasmia (female); insomnia, somnolence, dizziness, paresthesia, tremor; sinusitis, yawning; diarrhea, constipation, vomiting, dry mouth; sweating increased; athralgia, myalgia; male ejaculation disorder, impotence; fatigue, pyrexia; increased weight.
Diseases: Anxiety; Premenstrual Dysphoric Disorder; Depression; Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder.

Indications: Depression.
Contraindications: Unstable epilepsy. Concurrent administration with MAOI. Severe renal failure (GFR <10 mL/min). Lactation. Childn.
Adverse_Reactions: Asthenia, fever, nausea, vomiting, headache, nervousness, drowsiness, pharyngitis, skin rash, urticaria; dry mouth, diarrhoea, dyspepsia, insomnia; decreased pulse rate, bradycardia, extrapyramidal reaction & akathisia.
Diseases: Anxiety; Premenstrual Dysphoric Disorder; Depression; Fibromyalgia; Headache; Migraine Headache; Narcolepsy; Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder; Postpartum Depression.

Indications: Major depressive episodes, panic disorder with or without agoraphobia.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity. Concomitant treatment with non-selective, irreversible MAOIs.
Adverse_Reactions: Decreased appetite, insomnia, somnolence, dizziness, taste disturbance, sleep disorder.
Diseases: Anxiety; Premenstrual Dysphoric Disorder; Depression; Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder.

Indications: Major depressive episodes; panic disorder with or without agoraphobia; social anxiety disorder (social phobia); generalized anxiety disorder; obsessive-compulsive disorder.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity. Concomitant use with non-selective, irreversible MAOIs; pimozide.
Adverse_Reactions: Nausea. Decreased/increased appetite, increased weight; anxiety, restlessness, abnormal dreams, decreased libido, anorgasmia (in females); insomnia, somnolence, dizziness, paraesthesia, tremor; sinusitis, yawning; diarrhea, constipation, vomiting, dry mouth; increased sweating; arthralgia, myalgia; ejaculation disorder & impotence (in males); fatigue, pyrexia.
Diseases: Anxiety; Premenstrual Dysphoric Disorder; Depression; Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder.

Indications: Symptoms of depression in patients with or without a history of mania.
Contraindications: Concomitant or within 2 week of MAOI therapy.
Adverse_Reactions: Dry mouth, nausea, diarrhea/loose stools, male sexual dysfunction (primarily ejaculatory delay), increased sweating, dyspepsia.
Diseases: Anxiety; Premenstrual Dysphoric Disorder; Depression; Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder; Postpartum Depression.

Indications: Mania & hypomania, bipolar depression, control of aggressive behaviour or intentional self-harm.
Contraindications: Cardiac disease. Addison's disease or untreated hypothyroidism. Renal impairment. Pregnancy & lactation.
Adverse_Reactions: GI effects, muscle weakness, lack of coordination, drowsiness, dizziness, tinnitus, blurred vision, nausea, vertigo, dazed feeling, light hand tremors, thirst, polyuria. Weight gain, oedema. Memory impairment, hyperparathyroid.
Diseases: Depression; Headache; Bipolar Disorder.

Indications: Depressive illness & symptoms of depressive disorder.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity. In combination with MAOIs. Lactation.
Adverse_Reactions: Nausea, vomiting.
Diseases: Depression; Narcolepsy; Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder.

Indications: Depression, obsessive-compulsive disorders, bulimia.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity.
Adverse_Reactions: CNS effects (anxiety, nervousness, insomnia), GI effects (anorexia, nausea, diarrhea), drowsiness, fatigue, tremor, increased sweating, dizziness, lightheadedness, chills, increased appetite, weight loss, abnormal dream, agitation, bronchitis, rhinitis, yawn, headache, reduced libido.
Diseases: Anxiety; Premenstrual Dysphoric Disorder; Depression; Fibromyalgia; Headache; Migraine Headache; Narcolepsy; Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder; Postpartum Depression.

Indications: Endogenous depression.
Contraindications: Epilepsy or lowered convulsion threshold, acute MI, cardiac conduction defects, narrow-angle glaucoma, urinary retention. Acute poisoning with alcohol, hypnotics or psychotropic drugs. Concomitant treatment with MAOIs. Severe hepatic or renal impairment.
Adverse_Reactions: Frequent: Mild CNS & anticholinergic reactions. Occasional: Sinus tachycardia, postural hypotension, nausea, weight gain, allergic skin reactions.
Diseases: Depression.

Indications: In combination with SSRIs or SNRIs for adults with treatment-resistant major depressive disorder (MDD) who have not responded to at least 2 different treatments with antidepressants in current moderate to severe depressive episode.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity to esketamine, ketamine. Patients whom increased blood or intracranial pressure poses serious risk eg, patients with aneurysmal vascular disease including intracranial, thoracic, or abdominal aorta, or peripheral arterial vessels; history of intracerebral haemorrhage; recent (within 6 week) CV event including MI.
Adverse_Reactions: Dissociation; dizziness, headache, dysgeusia, somnolence, hypoaesthesia; vertigo; nausea, vomiting. Euphoric mood, agitation, anxiety, illusion, irritability, panic attack, altered time perception, hallucination including visual hallucination, derealisation; mental impairment, tremor, lethargy, dysarthria, paraesthesia, sedation; blurred vision; hyperacusis, tinnitus; tachycardia; HTN; nasal discomfort & dryness including nasal crusting & pruritus; dry mouth, oral hypoaesthesia; hyperhidrosis; pollakiuria, dysuria, micturition urgency; feeling abnormal, drunk & body temp change; increased BP.
Diseases: Depression.

Indications: Major depressive episodes.
Contraindications: Association with MAOIs. A washout period of 2 week is necessary between treatment with MAOIs & treatment with tianeptine. A washout period of only 24 hour is required when replacing tianeptine with a MAOI. Childn <15 year.
Adverse_Reactions: Rare & non-severe: epigastric pain, abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, constipation. Insomnia, drowsiness, asthenia. Dry mouth. Tachycardia, extrasystoles. Vertigo, headache, lipothymia, tremor, hot flushes. Resp discomfort. Myalgia, back pain.
Diseases: Depression.

Indications: Major depressive episodes in adult.
Contraindications: Hepatic impairment ie, cirrhosis or active liver disease.
Adverse_Reactions: Nausea migraine; diarrhea, constipation, upper abdominal pain; hyperhidrosis; back pain; fatigue; increased ALAT &/or ASAT; anxiety.
Diseases: Depression.

Indications: All types of depression with or without a history of mania. Prevention of relapse of initial or recurrent episodes of depression.
Contraindications: Concomitant or within 2 week of MAOI therapy.
Adverse_Reactions: Dry mouth, nausea, diarrhea/loose stool, male sexual dysfunction (primary ejaculatory delay), increased sweating, dyspepsia.
Diseases: Anxiety; Premenstrual Dysphoric Disorder; Depression; Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder; Postpartum Depression.

Indications: Schizophrenia.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity.
Adverse_Reactions: Increased weight, akathisia, injection site pain, sedation. Abdominal discomfort, constipation, diarrhoea, dry mouth, toothache, vomiting.
Diseases: Depression; Autistic Disorder; Bipolar Disorder; Schizophrenia; Tourette's Syndrome & Other Tic Disorders.

Indications: Schizophrenia.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity.
Adverse_Reactions: Nausea, headache, insomnia. Adult: Vomiting, constipation, dizziness, akathisia, anxiety, agitation. Adolescents & childn: Drowsiness, extrapyramidal disorders, fatigue, increased appetite, insomnia, nasopharyngitis, weight gain.
Diseases: Depression; Autistic Disorder; Bipolar Disorder; Schizophrenia; Tourette's Syndrome & Other Tic Disorders.

Indications: Schizophrenia. Acute & maintenance treatment of manic & mixed episodes associated with bipolar disorder. Irritability associated with autistic disorder. Adjunct for major depressive disorder.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity.
Adverse_Reactions: Akathisia, sedation, restlessness, tremor, extrapyramidal disorder, insomnia, fatigue, lethargy; blurred vision; headache, dizziness; somnolence; vomiting, nausea, constipation, dyspepsia, dry mouth, toothache, abdominal/stomach discomfort; musculoskeletal stiffness, pain in extremity, myalgia, muscle spasm; agitation, anxiety; nasopharyngitis; increased/decrease appetite.
Diseases: Depression; Autistic Disorder; Bipolar Disorder; Schizophrenia; Tourette's Syndrome & Other Tic Disorders.

Indications: Schizophrenia. Monotherapy & adjunct to lithium or valproate in acute treatment of manic & mixed episodes associated with bipolar I disorder & in maintenance treatment of bipolar I disorder. Adjunctive therapy to antidepressants for major depressive disorder. Irritability associated with autistic disorder. Tourette's disorder.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity.
Adverse_Reactions: Nausea, headache, insomnia. Adult: Constipation, dizziness, akathisia, anxiety, restlessness. Childn: Somnolence, vomiting, extrapyramidal disorder, fatigue, increased appetite & weight, nasopharyngitis.
Diseases: Depression; Autistic Disorder; Bipolar Disorder; Schizophrenia; Tourette's Syndrome & Other Tic Disorders.

Indications: Maintenance for acute schizophrenia & bipolar disorder for childn, adolescent & adult. Adjunctive therapy for major depressive disorder.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity.
Adverse_Reactions: Headache, nausea, vomiting, constipation, anxiety, insomnia, lightheadedness, somnolence, akathisia.
Diseases: Depression; Autistic Disorder; Bipolar Disorder; Schizophrenia; Tourette's Syndrome & Other Tic Disorders.

Indications: Schizophrenia & related psychoses, tranquillisation & emergency control in behavioural disturbances; adjunctive therapy in behavioural disorders due to mental retardation.
Contraindications: Bone marrow depression, Reye's syndrome; coma caused by barbiturates or alcohol. Severe hepatic or renal impairment. Childn <6 month.
Adverse_Reactions: Jaundice, postural hypotension & resp depression, blood dyscrasias, acute dystonia, tardive dyskinesia, visual disturbances, extrapyramidal reactions (high doses).
Diseases: Anxiety; Autistic Disorder; Bipolar Disorder; Schizophrenia; Nausea & Vomiting.

Indications: Schizophrenia in patients who are nonresponsive or intolerant of classical neuroleptics.
Contraindications: History of drug-induced granulocytopenia & agranulocytosis, impaired bone marrow function, uncontrolled epilepsy, alcoholic & other toxic psychoses, drug intoxication, comatose conditions, circulatory collapse, CNS depression, severe hepatic dysfunction & renal or cardiac failure.
Adverse_Reactions: Granulocytopenia, agranulocytosis, eosinophilia &/or leucocytosis. Fatigue, drowsiness, sedation, dizziness, headache, EEG changes; hypersalivation, dry mouth, blurred vision, sweating & temp regulation disturbances; tachycardia, postural hypotension, HTN, collapse, cardiac arrhythmias, pericarditis, myocarditis, circulatory collapse, resp depression or arrest; nausea, vomiting, constipation, incontinence or urinary retention, priapism, acute interstitial nephritis, benign hyperthermia, hyperglycemia, weight gain.
Diseases: Bipolar Disorder; Schizophrenia.

Indications: Maintenance treatment of chronic schizophrenia & other psychoses.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity. Comatose state, CNS depression due to alcohol or other depressant drug, Parkinson's disease, dementia with Lewy bodies, progressive supranuclear palsy.
Adverse_Reactions: Extrapyramidal disorder, tremor, parkinsonism, somnolence, masked facies, akathisia, sedation, akinesia, dyskinesia, hypertonia, dystonia, cogwheel rigidity, neuroleptic malignant syndrome, tardive dyskinesia, bradykinesia, dizziness, hyperkinesia, hypokinesia, motor dysfunction, involuntary muscle contractions, nystagmus; dry mouth, constipation, salivary hypersecretion; muscle rigidity; sexual dysfunction; injection site reaction; increased weight; blurred vision, visual disturbances, oculogyric crisis; tachycardia; hyperprolactinaemia; increased libido, restlessness; hypotension, orthostatic hypotension; trismus, toricollis, muscle spasms, musculoskeletal stiffness, muscle twitching; amenorrhoea, galactorrhoea, menstrual disorder, erectile dysfunction, breast discomfort, breast pain, dysmenorrhoea, menorrhagia; gait disturbance.
Diseases: Anxiety; Schizophrenia; Tourette's Syndrome & Other Tic Disorders; Nausea & Vomiting.

Indications: Acute treatment & maintenance of schizophrenia & other psychoses when positive &/or negative symptoms are prominent. Moderate to severe manic episode. Prevention of recurrence in patient with bipolar disorder.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity. Narrow-angle glaucoma.
Adverse_Reactions: Somnolence, weight gain, eosinophilia, increased plasma prolactin, cholesterol, glucose & triglyceride levels, dizziness, akathisia, Parkinson's disease, dyskinesia, orthostatic hypotension, cholinergic symptoms, asymptomatic transient increase in liver enzyme levels, rash, asthenia, fatigue & edema.
Diseases: Depression; Bipolar Disorder; Schizophrenia.

Indications: Schizophrenia, manic & depressive episodes associated with bipolar disorder.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity. Concomitant administration with cytochrome P450 3A4 inhibitors eg, HIV-PIs, azole-antifungal agents, erythromycin, clarithromycin & nefazodone.
Adverse_Reactions: Decreased haemoglobin; elevated serum triglycerides, elevated total cholesterol (predominantly LDL cholesterol), decreased HDL cholesterol, weight gain; dizziness, somnolence, headache, extrapyramidal symptoms; dry mouth; withdrawal symptoms. Leucopenia, decreased neutrophil count, increased eosinophils; hyperprolactinaemia, total T4, free T4, total T3 decreased, increased TSH; increased appetite, blood glucose increased to hyperglycaemic levels; abnormal dreams & nightmares, suicidal ideation & behaviour; dysarthria; tachycardia, palpitations; blurred vision; orthostatic hypotension; dyspnoea; constipation, dyspepsia, vomiting; elevated ALT, elevated gamma-GT levels; mild asthenia, peripheral oedema, irritability, pyrexia.
Diseases: Anxiety; Depression; Bipolar Disorder; Schizophrenia.

Indications: Acute treatment & maintenance of schizophrenia & other psychoses when positive &/or negative symptoms are prominent. Moderate to severe manic episode. Prevention of recurrence in patient with bipolar disorder.
Contraindications: Narrow-angle glaucoma.
Adverse_Reactions: Somnolence, weight gain, increase plasma prolactin levels, dizziness, akathisia, increased appetite, peripheral edema, orthostatic hypotension, dry mouth, asymptomatic eosinophilia, constipation, transient increase in liver enzyme levels, neuroleptic malignant syndrome, tardive dyskinesia.
Diseases: Depression; Bipolar Disorder; Schizophrenia.

Indications: Exacerbation & maintenance of schizophrenia for adults.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity.
Adverse_Reactions: Dyspepsia, diarrhea; increased weight, increased blood creatine phosphokinase; akathisia, tremor, sedation.
Diseases: Depression; Schizophrenia.

Indications: Risperdal Acute & chronic schizophrenic psychoses, including first episode psychoses, & other psychotic conditions in which positive &/or negative symptoms are prominent. Alleviates affective symptoms associated with schizophrenia. Manic episodes associated with bipolar disorders. Agitation, aggression or psychotic symptoms in moderate to severe dementia of the Alzheimer type. Conduct & other disruptive behaviour disorders where aggressive or other disruptive behaviors are prominent. Improves adaptive skills in childn with autistic disorder. Risperdal Consta Schizophrenia & schizoaffective disorder. Monotherapy & adjunctive maintenance treatment of bipolar I disorder to delay occurrence of mood episodes.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity.
Adverse_Reactions: Anaphylactic reaction. Infections & infestations; blood & lymphatic system disorders; hypersensitivity; psychiatric disorders; nervous system disorders; eye disorders; ear & labyrinth disorders; cardiac disorders; vascular disorders; resp, thoracic & mediastinal disorders; GI disorders; skin & SC tissue disorders; musculoskeletal & connective tissue disorders; renal & urinary disorders; reproductive system & breast disorders; fatigue, pain, asthenia, peripheral edema, pyrexia, feeling abnormal, sluggishness, chest pain/discomfort, abnormal gait, edema; increased blood creatinine phosphokinase, increased heart rate; metabolism & nutrition disorders; body temp increase/decrease, weight increase/decrease, increased blood prolactin; injury, poisoning & procedural complications; endocrine disorders; hepatobiliary disorders; chills, discomfort, drug withdrawal syndrome, face oedema, induration, malaise, peripheral coldness, thirst.
Diseases: Autistic Disorder; Bipolar Disorder; Schizophrenia; Tourette's Syndrome & Other Tic Disorders.

Indications: Acute & maintenance treatment of schizophrenia. Bipolar disorder including manic episodes associated with bipolar I disorder & depressive episodes associated with bipolar disorder. Add-on treatment of major depressive episodes in patients with major depressive disorder (MDD) who have had inadequate response after 6 week treatment of antidepressant monotherapy.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity. Concomitant administration with CYP450 3A4 inhibitors eg, HIV-PIs, azole antifungals, erythromycin, clarithromycin & nefazodone.
Adverse_Reactions: Decreased Hb; elevated serum triglyceride & total cholesterol, decreased HDL, weight gain; dizziness, somnolence, headache, extrapyramidal symptoms; dry mouth; withdrawal symptoms. Leucopenia, decreased neutrophil, increased eosinophil; hyperprolactinaemia, decreased total T4, free T4 & total T3, increased TSH; increased appetite, blood glucose to hyperglycaemic levels; abnormal dreams & nightmares, suicidal ideation & behaviour; dysarthria; tachycardia, palpitations; blurred vision; orthostatic hypotension; dyspnoea; constipation, dyspepsia, vomiting; elevated ALT & gamma-GT levels; mild asthenia, peripheral oedema, irritability, pyrexia.
Diseases: Anxiety; Depression; Bipolar Disorder; Schizophrenia.

Indications: Long-term management of psychotic disorder eg, chronic schizophrenia.
Contraindications: Comatose & severely-depressed states, marked cerebral & hepatic damage, jaundice, atherosclerosis, phaeochromocytoma, existing blood dyscrasias, renal & cardiac insufficiency.
Adverse_Reactions: Acute dystonic reactions, parkinsonian-like states, tardive dyskinesia; drowsiness, lethargy, blurred vision, dry mouth, constipation, urinary hesitancy or incontinence, mild hypotension, impaired judgement & mental skills, epileptiform attacks; abnormal skin pigmentation & lens opacities. ECG changes with prolonged QT interval & T-wave changes; serious arrhythmias including ventricular tachycardia & fibrillation. Hypothermia; neuroleptic malignant syndrome; hyperprolactinaemia, impaired sexual function; oedema.
Diseases: Anxiety; Schizophrenia.

Indications: Treatment-resistant schizophrenic patients who are nonresponsive or intolerant to classical neuroleptics.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity. History of drug-induced granulocytopenia/agranulocytosis; impaired bone marrow function; circulatory collapse or CNS depression; severe hepatic, renal or cardiac failure.
Adverse_Reactions: Granulocytopenia, agranulocytosis; fatigue, drowsiness, sedation, dizziness, headache; tachycardia, postural hypotension with or without syncope; nausea, vomiting, constipation.
Diseases: Bipolar Disorder; Schizophrenia.

Indications: Low dose: Control of nervousness, tension, agitation. Nausea & vomiting from various origins. High dose: Acute & chronic catatonic, hebephrenic schizophrenia & paranoia, psychosis due to organic brain damage & intoxication. Control of manic-depressive disease symptoms.
Contraindications: Coma, severe depression, blood dyscrasia, bone-marrow depression, hepatic disease.
Adverse_Reactions: Asthenia, nervousness, drowsiness, insomnia, dry mouth, blurred vision, muscle weakness, hypotension, extrapyramidal symptoms (high-dose usage or patients >40 year).
Diseases: Anxiety; Schizophrenia; Nausea & Vomiting.

Indications: Acute & maintenance treatment of schizophrenia & other psychoses where positive &/or negative symptoms are prominent. Alleviates secondary affective symptoms commonly associated with schizophrenia & related disorders. Moderate to severe manic episode. Prevention of recurrence of manic episode in patients with bipolar disorder.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity. Known risk of narrow-angle glaucoma.
Adverse_Reactions: Weight gain; sedation; elevated plasma prolactin levels. Dry mouth. Adult: Somnolence; orthostatic hypotension. Eosinophilia, leukopenia, neutropenia; pyrexia; elevated cholesterol, glucose & triglyceride levels, glucosuria, increased appetite; dizziness, akathisia, parkinsonism, dyskinesia; mild, transient anticholinergic effect including constipation; transient, asymptomatic elevations of hepatic transaminases (ALT, AST); rash; arthralgia; asthenia, fatigue, oedema; increased alkaline phosphatase, high gamma-glutamyltransferase (GGT) & uric acid. Adolescent 13-17 year: Increased appetite; ALT/SGPT >3 x ULN, increased AST/SGOT & triglycerides, decreased total bilirubin & total cholesterol.
Diseases: Depression; Bipolar Disorder; Schizophrenia.

Indications: Petit mal epilepsy.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity. Impaired liver function. Pregnancy.

Adverse_Reactions: Nausea, vomiting, dyspepsia, gastric pyrosis, abdominal pain, diarrhea, intestinal microlesions, ulcerative activation & hemorrhages. Indications: Short-term management of moderate post-op pain.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity to ketorolac or other NSAIDs. Active peptic ulcer, cerebrovascular disease, hemorrhagic diatheses including coagulation disorders, hypovolemia; history of asthma, patients under-op with high risk of hemorrhage haemostasis, on anticoagulant including low dose heparin (2500-5000 U every 12 hour); suspected or confirmed cerebrovascular bleeding, complete or partial nasal polyps syndrome, angioedema or bronchospasm; history of SJS or vesicular bullous rash. Concomitant use with oxpentifylline, probenecid, other NSAIDs. Neuraxial (epidural or intrathecal) administration; prophylaxis before major surgery or intra-op when haemostasis is critical due to increased bleeding risk. Moderate to severe renal impairment (serum creatinine >160 mumol/L). Pregnancy, labor, delivery or lactation. Childn <16 year.
Adverse_Reactions: GI disturbances; CNS & musculoskeletal, urinary tract & renal, CV/hematological, resp tract disorders; dermatological & hypersensitivity reactions; bleeding; abnormal liver functions, asthenia, edema, weight gain, hepatic disorder, fever.
Diseases: Dysmenorrhea - Primary.

Indications: Ulcerative colitis.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity to sulfonamide & salicylates; urinary & GI obstruction; porphyria. Lactation. Childn <2 year.
Adverse_Reactions: Headache, nausea, loss of appetite, fever & rash; fatal leucopenia, neutropenia, thrombocytopenia & aplastic anemia; stomatitis, parotitis, pancreatitis, hepatitis; vertigo, tinnitus, peripheral neuropathy, ataxia, insomnia, convulsion, mental depression, aseptic meningitis, hallucination; hematuria, proteinuria, nephrotic syndrome, crystalluria, hypersensitivity reaction.
Diseases: Rheumatoid Arthritis; Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis; Psoriatic Arthritis.

Indications: Mild to moderate pain due to headache, toothache, primary dysmenorrhea, including pain due to trauma, muscle pain & post-op pain.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity. Gastric & peptic ulcer, severe kidney disorders, patients in whom aspirin cause bronchospasm, allergic rhinitis & urticaria.
Adverse_Reactions: Nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain; leucopenia, eosinophilia, thrombocytopenia, agranulocytopenia; drowsiness, dizziness, blurred vision, insomnia.

Indications: Symptomatic treatment of RA, OA, ankylosing spondylitis, extra articular disorders eg, tendinitis, bursitis, periarthritis of shoulder or hips, strains & sprains, acute gout.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity to salicylates & NSAIDs. Severe upper GIT diseases. Patients undergoing anesth or surgery.
Adverse_Reactions: GI upsets; dizziness, headache; rash, erythema, urticaria; increase in BUN or creatinine, SGOT, SGPT, bilirubin. Decrease Hb, granulocytopenia; slight edema, photodermatosis.
Diseases: Low Back Pain; Osteoarthritis; Paget's Bone Disease; Rheumatoid Arthritis; Dysmenorrhea - Primary; Ankylosing Spondylitis; Gout; Psoriatic Arthritis; Tendinopathy.

Indications: RA, OA, ankylosing spondylitis, extra-articular inflammation, acute gouty arthritis.
Contraindications: Peptic/duodenal ulcer, patients with salicylate or other NSAID-induced asthma, rhinitis or urticaria.
Adverse_Reactions: Gastralgia, nausea, pyrosis, diarrhea; urticaria, pruritus, rash; headache, dizziness.
Diseases: Low Back Pain; Osteoarthritis; Paget's Bone Disease; Rheumatoid Arthritis; Dysmenorrhea - Primary; Ankylosing Spondylitis; Gout; Psoriatic Arthritis; Tendinopathy.

Indications: Acute musculoskeletal pain, post-op pain, dysmenorrhea.
Contraindications: History of asthma attack, bronchial asthma, bronchospasm, acute rhinitis, nasal polyp, urticaria, or angioneurotic edema; active or suspected gastric ulcer, chronic dyspepsia, gastric bleeding or other active bleeding, Crohn's disease or ulcerative colitis, severe heart failure, moderate-severe kidney dysfunction (CrCl <50 mL/min), severe liver impairment (Child Pugh score 10-15); hemorrhagic diathesis & other coagulation disorders or receiving anticoagulant therapy; neuraxial (intrathecal or epidural) administration. Pregnancy & lactation.
Adverse_Reactions: Increase CV thrombotic events, MI & stroke; HTN; fluid retention & edema; GI inflammation, bleeding, gastric & intestinal ulceration & perforation.
Diseases: Chronic Pelvic Pain; Low Back Pain; Osteoarthritis; Rheumatoid Arthritis; Dysmenorrhea - Primary; Ankylosing Spondylitis; Gout; Tendinopathy.

Indications: Mild to moderate pain intensity eg, musculoskeletal acute pain, dysmenorrhea, toothache; acute pain intensity eg, post-op pain.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity to dexketoprofen trometamol or other NSAIDs. NSAID-induced asthma. Peptic ulcer/gastric bleeding. Hemorrhagic disorder. Severe heart failure. Kidney disorder. Severe hepatic disorder. Pregnancy & lactation.
Adverse_Reactions: HTN, tachycardia, dyspepsia, peptic ulcer, gastritis, headache, skin rash, pruritus. Nausea, vomiting, GI bleeding, anaphylaxis.
Diseases: Chronic Pelvic Pain; Low Back Pain; Osteoarthritis; Rheumatoid Arthritis; Dysmenorrhea - Primary; Ankylosing Spondylitis; Gout; Tendinopathy.

Indications: Short term treatment of acute post-traumatic pain eg, sprain, post-op pain & inflammation eg, tooth operation or orthopaedy. Adjuvant therapy in severe painful inflammation of ENT infection eg, tonsillopharyngitis & otitis.
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity. Gastric ulcer. Patients with history of NSAID-induced asthma, urticaria or rhinitis. Ischaemic heart, peripheral arterial & cerebrovascular disease. CHF (NYHA II-IV).
Adverse_Reactions: GI, CNS & peripheral nerve system, skin, urogenital, hematological effects. Increased SGOT/SGPT, hepatitis with or without jaundice, fulminant hepatitis. Hypersensitivity reactions eg, asthma, systemic anaphylaxis/anaphylactoid reactions. Edema.
Diseases: Cancer Pain; Headache; Migraine Headache; Low Back Pain; Osteoarthritis; Paget's Bone Disease; Rheumatoid Arthritis; Dysmenorrhea - Primary; Tonsillopharyngitis - Acute; Tonsillopharyngitis - Acute (Pediatric); Ankylosing Spondylitis; Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis; Gout; Psoriatic Arthritis; Tendinopathy.
